title: Claude Code Instructions
text: NEVER use Urban Institute API, NCES CCD, federal data source — entire point packages provide STATE-LEVEL data directly state . Federal sources aggregate/transform data differently lose state-specific details. state DOE source broken, FIX find alternative STATE source — fall back federal data.

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: NEVER reference Claude, Claude Code, AI assistance commit messages NEVER reference Claude, Claude Code, AI assistance PR descriptions NEVER add Co-Authored-lines mentioning Claude Anthropic Keep commit messages focused changed, written

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: package includes tests/testthat/test-pipeline-live.R LIVE network tests.

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: URL Availability - HTTP 200 checks File Download - Verify actual file (HTML error) File Parsing - readxl/readr succeeds Column Structure - Expected columns exist get_raw_enr() - Raw data function works Data Quality - Inf/NaN, non-negative counts Aggregation - State total > 0 Output Fidelity - tidy=TRUE matches raw

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: See state-schooldata/CLAUDE.md complete testing framework documentation.

title: Georgia School Data
text: Documentation | Getting Started Fetch analyze Georgia school enrollment data Governor’s Office Student Achievement (GOSA) R Python.

what: What can you find with gaschooldata?
title: Georgia School Data
text: 14 years enrollment data (2011-2024). 1.7 million students today. 180 districts. ten stories hiding numbers:

previous_headings: What can you find with gaschooldata?
what: 1. Georgia keeps growing while other states shrink
title: Georgia School Data
text: Unlike many states losing students, Georgia added 50,000+ students past decade. Metro Atlanta’s population boom real.
code: library(gaschooldata) library(dplyr)  enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2015:2024)  enr %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   select(end_year, n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with gaschooldata?
what: 2. Gwinnett County is Georgia’s school system giant
title: Georgia School Data
text: Gwinnett County Public Schools serves 180,000 students, making largest district Georgia one largest nation. Gwinnett, Cobb, Fulton, DeKalb, Clayton County form metro Atlanta powerhouse, serving 600,000 students combined.
code: enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students)) %>%   select(district_name, n_students) %>%   head(5)

previous_headings: What can you find with gaschooldata?
title: Georgia School Data
text: Georgia’s Hispanic student population doubled since 2011. One five Georgia students now Hispanic. 12% 20% just decade.
code: enr %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "hispanic") %>%   select(end_year, n_students, pct)

previous_headings: What can you find with gaschooldata?
title: Georgia School Data
text: Georgia lost 15,000 kindergartners 2020 2021. students never fully came back.
code: enr %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "K") %>%   filter(end_year %in% 2019:2024) %>%   select(end_year, n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with gaschooldata?
title: Georgia School Data
text: suburban Atlanta booms, Atlanta Public Schools lost 20% enrollment since 2015. Gentrification reshaping city’s schools.
code: enr %>%   filter(grepl("Atlanta City|Atlanta Public", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE),          is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   select(end_year, district_name, n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with gaschooldata?
what: 6. White students are now a minority
title: Georgia School Data
text: 2011, white students 44% enrollment. Today ’re 35%. Georgia schools reflect New South.
code: enr %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian")) %>%   group_by(end_year, subgroup) %>%   summarize(n = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%   group_by(end_year) %>%   mutate(pct = n / sum(n) * 100)

previous_headings: What can you find with gaschooldata?
title: Georgia School Data
text: Gwinnett County gains 2,000 students per year, rural districts like Taliaferro County fewer 300 students total. schools single-digit graduating classes.
code: enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   arrange(n_students) %>%   select(district_name, n_students) %>%   head(10)

previous_headings: What can you find with gaschooldata?
title: Georgia School Data
text: State charter schools district-authorized charters now serve 100,000 Georgia students, 30,000 decade ago.
code: enr_2024 %>%   filter(grepl("Charter", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE),          grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   summarize(total_charter = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE))

previous_headings: What can you find with gaschooldata?
title: Georgia School Data
text: Georgia’s English Learner population grown 50% since 2015, driven immigration metro Atlanta.
code: enr %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "lep") %>%   select(end_year, n_students, pct)

previous_headings: What can you find with gaschooldata?
title: Georgia School Data
text: Forsyth, Cherokee, Henry counties Georgia’s fastest-growing districts. suburban Atlanta counties barely existed education map 30 years ago.
code: enr %>%   filter(district_name %in% c("Forsyth County", "Cherokee County", "Henry County"),          is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   select(end_year, district_name, n_students)

title: Georgia School Data
code: library(gaschooldata) library(dplyr)  # Fetch one year enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Fetch multiple years enr_recent <- fetch_enr_multi(2020:2024)  # State totals enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  # District breakdown enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students))  # Demographics by district enr_2024 %>%   filter(is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian")) %>%   group_by(district_name, subgroup) %>%   summarize(n = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE))

title: Georgia School Data
code: import pygaschooldata as ga  # See available years years = ga.get_available_years() print(f"Data available from {years['min_year']} to {years['max_year']}")  # Fetch one year enr_2024 = ga.fetch_enr(2024)  # Fetch multiple years enr_multi = ga.fetch_enr_multi([2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024])  # State totals state_total = enr_2024[     (enr_2024['is_state'] == True) &     (enr_2024['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &     (enr_2024['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') ]  # District breakdown districts = enr_2024[     (enr_2024['is_district'] == True) &     (enr_2024['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &     (enr_2024['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') ].sort_values('n_students', ascending=False)

title: Georgia School Data
text: Levels: State, district (~180), school (~2,300) Demographics: White, Black, Hispanic, Asian, Native American, Pacific Islander, Multiracial Special populations: English Learners (LEP), Special Education, Economically Disadvantaged Grade levels: Pre-K Grade 12

title: Georgia School Data
text: Georgia uses district school codes: - District Code: 3-digit code (e.g., 660 Gwinnett County) - School Code: 4-digit code within district

what: gaschooldata: Fetch and Process Georgia School Data — gaschooldata-package
title: gaschooldata: Fetch and Process Georgia School Data — gaschooldata-package
text: Downloads processes school data Governor's Office Student Achievement (GOSA). Provides functions fetching enrollment data demographic breakdowns transforming tidy format analysis.

title: gaschooldata: Fetch and Process Georgia School Data — gaschooldata-package
text: package supports enrollment data 2011 2024: 2011-2024: GOSA (full demographics special populations) GOSA provides enrollment data 2010-11 school year 2023-24. historical data prior 2011, users must submit data request directly GOSA: https://gosa.georgia.gov/dashboards-data-report-card/data-requests

title: gaschooldata: Fetch and Process Georgia School Data — gaschooldata-package
text: fetch_enr Fetch enrollment data school year fetch_enr_multi Fetch enrollment data multiple years get_available_years Get range available years (2011-2024)

title: gaschooldata: Fetch and Process Georgia School Data — gaschooldata-package
text: cache_status View cached data files clear_cache Remove cached data files

title: gaschooldata: Fetch and Process Georgia School Data — gaschooldata-package
text: Georgia uses hierarchical ID system: District IDs: 3-4 digits (system code, e.g., 660 = Fulton County) School IDs: 4 digits (school number within district) Full school code: district + school (e.g., 660-0001)

title: gaschooldata: Fetch and Process Georgia School Data — gaschooldata-package
text: Data sourced exclusively Georgia state sources: GOSA Downloadable Data: https://gosa.georgia.gov/dashboards-data-report-card/downloadable-data GOSA Data Repository: https://download.gosa.ga.gov/

title: gaschooldata: Fetch and Process Georgia School Data — gaschooldata-package
text: Maintainer: Al Martin almartin@example.com

what: Get available years for Georgia enrollment data — get_available_years
title: Get available years for Georgia enrollment data — get_available_years
text: Returns range years available GOSA (Governor's Office Student Achievement). GOSA provides enrollment data 2010-11 school year (end_year = 2011) 2023-24 (end_year = 2024).

title: Get available years for Georgia enrollment data — get_available_years
Get available years for Georgia enrollment data — get_available_years
text: list components: min_year Integer. earliest available year (2011). max_year Integer. recent available year (2024). description Character. description data availability.

title: Get available years for Georgia enrollment data — get_available_years
code: get_available_years() #> $min_year #> [1] 2011 #>  #> $max_year #> [1] 2024 #>  #> $description #> [1] "GOSA enrollment data (2010-11 through 2023-24 school years)" #>  # Returns list(min_year = 2011, max_year = 2024, description = "...")
